item.title: Logging in Python
item.description: One of the most underestimated topics that I’ve seen in my working experience is logs management. A lot of people don’t care at all about logging the execution of their programs and I’ve seen a lot of code released in the production environment that doesn’t log anything. To log seems to be a waste of time to them, especially if the code they’re writing is apparently simple. So, why bother logging the execution of a program if the program can run great with no logs?
